description: From Middle French denoter, from Latin denotare, from de- (“complete”) and notare (“to mark out”).

verbs.description: denote (third-person singular simple present denotes, present participle denoting, simple past and past participle denoted)

examples: The yellow blazes denote the trail.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To refer to literally; to convey as meaning.
examples: The prefix pre- denotes "before", as in preview.
